args.natural_language_statement:
Translate the following mathematical statement into Lean4 (import Mathlib at the top and end the Lean statement with := by sorry):

Let E be a finite-dimensional real normed space (e.g. â„^n). Let U âŠ† E be convex. Let f : E â†’ â„ be C^2 on U (ContDiffOn â„ 2 f U) and assume the Hessian (second derivative) is continuous on U (this follows from ContDiffOn). Show that the second-order Taylor expansion is uniform on compact subsets of U: more precisely, for every compact K âŠ† U and every Îµ > 0 there exists Î´ > 0 such that for all x âˆˆ K and all h âˆˆ E with x + h âˆˆ U and â€–hâ€– < Î´ we have

|f(x + h) - f(x) - fderiv â„ f x h - (1/2) * ((fderiv â„ (Î» y, fderiv â„ f y) x) h) h| â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€–^2.

Write a Lean4 theorem expressing this statement and end the theorem with := by sorry.

args.content:
import Mathlib

variables {E : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [FiniteDimensional â„ E]
  {U K : Set E} {f : E â†’ â„}

/-- Let E be a finite-dimensional real normed space. Let U âŠ† E be convex. Let f : E â†’ â„ be C^2 on U (ContDiffOn â„ 2 f U).
    The second-order Taylor expansion is uniform on compact subsets of U: for every compact K âŠ† U and every Îµ > 0
    there exists Î´ > 0 such that for all x âˆˆ K and all h âˆˆ E with x + h âˆˆ U and â€–hâ€– < Î´ we have

    |f(x + h) - f(x) - fderiv â„ f x h - (1/2) * ((fderiv â„ (Î» y, fderiv â„ f y) x) h) h| â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€–^2. -/
theorem uniform_second_order_taylor_on_compact (hU_convex : Convex â„ U)
  (hf : ContDiffOn â„ 2 f U) (hK : IsCompact K) (hKsub : K âŠ† U) :
  âˆ€ Îµ > (0 : â„), âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ x âˆˆ K, âˆ€ (h : E), x + h âˆˆ U â†’ â€–hâ€– < Î´ â†’
    abs (f (x + h) - f x - (fderiv â„ f x) h - (1 / 2 : â„) * ((fderiv â„ (fun y => fderiv â„ f y) x) h) h)
      â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€– ^ 2 := by sorry
